Posts.Content: Thank you, Chuck, for immediate reply and support! I had no idea where exactly I put my post. I registered same day. Indeed I write from Bulgaria. So I appologize for further mistakes, but English in not my mother language. We do not have such places for support here...especially for men's problems. As to pre -op: 5,5 in July 2014, 6,3 in Sept, 7,3 in Nov. Da Vince in Germany in December Radical prostatectomy specimen with a well differentiate acinar( ductal) adenocarcinoma (GleasonS core3 + 3 = 6) in both sides f the prostate occupying up to 10% of the whole prostatic volume without lymphovascular invasion without blood vessel invasion, with perineural ln vasion dorso-lateral on right side.Complete infiltration of the prostate capsule o\ n ther riqht.No infiltration of periprostatic tissue. Withouit invasion of the seminal vesicles. Minimal distance to the resection margins dorso-lateral 0,1 on both sides. All surgical margins free of tumour. GradingG: 1 (GleasonS core3 + 3 = 6) TNM-stag(e2 010)o: T2cN XM 0 L0V 0 Pn1 R classification:rR0 ( surgical margins negative The day after he returned from Germany he returned to work, no incontinence or other expected problems. Since 01.05 PSA started to insrease. I have no idea how he feels exactly. He do not stop to play tennis, volleyball , to do his job and meet the 1000's of friends who wants to seem him everyday...including me One more time, thank you for your time and support! Sincerely, Sue
Posts.Title: Prostate cancer at 40

Posts.Content: Thank you, Michael! Wish you all the best! Sincerely, Sue
Posts.Title: Prostate cancer at 40

Posts.Content: Thank you, Jim! Wish you all the best in the future!

Posts.Content: Thank you, Allen! You reply encouraged me! Sometimes I have the feeling that exactly the stress will kill us, not the cancer. Thank youone more time. Best regards, sue

Posts.Title: Prostate cancer at 40

Posts.Content: My friend (40 years old) had radical prostatectomy last December.After surgegy the PSA was undetectable for 4-5months. Since May PSA increased to 0,2 for 2 months and he started radiation therapy (33 procedures). I shall truly appreciate if somebody with similar experience could give more info..What we could expect? He is starting to lose hope..Any information would be highly appreciated. Sincerely,
Posts.Title: Prostate cancer at 40

Posts.Content: Thank you, Michael! Wish you all the best! Sincerely, Sue
